marklogic.body: I tells you: the best baked beans is to pour most of the ridiculous tomato sauce out of the pan. Having simmered the beans for a bit in the sauce. Then turn the hob. Then just let the beans sit for as much as 20 or 25 minutes. They will hopefully crinkle a bit. Obviously then prepare the tea and toast. A strong tea tastes even better with this version of beans and toast. You can actually taste the baked beans and not the salt- and sugar-ridden tomato sauce. By pouring out that sauce during the Heating process you get rid of most of that salt and sugar. I Always look forward to it. Even if it takes nearly an hour for the way I do it. I am not emaciated. I can wait a bit.
